intro: Cynometra sakalava, commonly known as the Sakalava ironwood, is a large deciduous tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its dense, heavy wood that is highly valued for construction and fuel. The tree has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, Cynometra sakalava is considered a threatened species.
